title: Phase 1: Foundation & Analysis
description: Analyze decompiled code structure, catalog all unnamed functions/globals, identify module boundaries, and plan architecture
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All 436 FUN_0x functions catalogued with context notes
- [ ] All 231 DAT_0x globals catalogued with usage patterns
- [ ] Module boundaries identified (UI, graphics, filesystem, picking, data structures)
- [ ] SGI GL to OpenGL mapping documented
- [ ] Architecture document created

title: Phase 3: Function & Variable Cleanup
description: Rename all FUN_0x functions and DAT_0x globals to meaningful names based on context analysis. Address halt_baddata calls and triage Ghidra warnings
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All 436 FUN_ functions renamed meaningfully
- [ ] All 231 DAT_ globals renamed meaningfully  
- [ ] 831 halt_baddata() calls addressed (stubbed or fixed)
- [ ] 1808 Ghidra WARNING comments triaged and documented
- [ ] Code readability significantly improved

title: Phase 2: Header Extraction & Type System
description: Extract struct definitions into organized headers, add standard library includes, create wrapper headers for X11/Motif and OpenGL, fix type definitions
design: Use OpenMotif library directly - no need to port X11/Motif code to modern toolkit. Just create wrapper headers for clean organization of Xt/Xm includes and types.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All struct definitions extracted to appropriate headers
- [ ] Standard C library includes added (stdio, stdlib, string, dirent, sys/stat)
- [ ] X11/Motif wrapper headers created
- [ ] OpenGL graphics headers created  
- [ ] All undefined4 types replaced with proper int32_t/types
- [ ] Code still in monolithic fsn.c but with proper includes

title: Phase 4: Modularization
description: Split 78K-line monolithic fsn.c into logical modules with proper separation of concerns
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] ui_motif.c created (X11/Motif dialogs, menus, widgets)
- [ ] graphics_gl.c created (rendering, 3D visualization)
- [ ] filesystem.c created (directory scanning, file operations)
- [ ] datastructures.c created (tree management, node handling)
- [ ] picking.c created (selection/interaction system)
- [ ] main.c created (init, event loop, CLI parsing)
- [ ] Corresponding header files created for each module
- [ ] No circular dependencies between modules

title: Phase 7: Testing & Refinement
description: Verify all functionality works, test 3D visualization and interaction, performance tuning
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] File browsing works (can navigate directories)
- [ ] File display works (shows directory contents)
- [ ] 3D visualization renders geometry correctly
- [ ] All landscapes work (grass, ocean, desert, space, indigo)
- [ ] Mouse interaction works (selection, navigation)
- [ ] Picking system accurately selects objects
- [ ] No critical performance issues
- [ ] Application stable during normal usage

title: Document SGI GL to OpenGL API mapping
description: Create comprehensive mapping of all SGI GL calls used in fsn.c to their OpenGL/GLM equivalents
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All SGI GL function calls identified
- [ ] OpenGL equivalents documented for each
- [ ] Picking API replacement strategy documented (raycasting)
- [ ] Reference implementation examples created

title: Catalog all FUN_ functions (366 total)
description: Extract all FUN_0x function definitions from fsn.c, analyze their context (callers, callees, operations), and create mapping to meaningful names
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All 366 FUN_ functions extracted to catalog file
- [ ] Context analysis completed (what they do, where called from)
- [ ] Preliminary meaningful names suggested for each

title: Phase 6: Integration & Build
description: Link all dependencies, resolve compilation and linker errors, handle MIPS to x86-64 porting issues, get basic runtime working
design: Build dependencies: OpenMotif (libXm, libXt, libX11) for UI, OpenGL (libGL, libGLU) for graphics, GLM for math/raycasting. CMake should detect these libraries and fail early with clear error if missing.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] CMake successfully finds all dependencies (Xm, Xt, X11, GL, GLU)
- [ ] Code compiles without errors on Linux x86-64
- [ ] All linker errors resolved
- [ ] MIPS/IRIX compatibility issues addressed
- [ ] Application launches and creates window
- [ ] OpenGL context initializes correctly

title: FSN Restoration: Ghidra Decompile to Functional Linux Binary
description: Convert 78K-line MIPS/IRIX Ghidra decompile of fsn (Fusion 3D file manager from Jurassic Park) into functional modern Linux binary with OpenGL graphics and modular codebase
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Code compiles on modern Linux x86-64
- [ ] Application launches and creates GL window
- [ ] File browser navigates directories
- [ ] 3D visualization renders correctly
- [ ] Mouse interaction/picking works
- [ ] All modules properly separated
- [ ] Build system handles dependencies

title: Phase 5: SGI GL to OpenGL Port
description: Convert all SGI Graphics Library calls to modern OpenGL equivalents
design: Convert SGI IRIX GL to OpenGL equivalents. For picking system: IRIX GL picking APIs (gselect/pick/endpick) will be replaced with raycasting implementation using GLM library. Raycasting approach: cast ray from mouse position through view frustum, test intersection with scene geometry.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Primitive functions mapped (rect/circf → GL vertex arrays/buffers)
- [ ] Picking system converted (gselect/pick → GL selection or raycasting)
- [ ] Transform operations updated (SGI matrix → GLM or manual matrices)  
- [ ] Mesh/polygon rendering modernized (bgnpolygon → VBO/VAO)
- [ ] Each conversion tested incrementally
- [ ] All SGI GL calls eliminated from codebase
